text: - [Matt] Hi, I'm Matt Sue,
Senior Product Manager for AWS Glue.
In this video, I'll show you how

to use Amazon Q data
integration in AWS Glue

to build data integration
pipelines using natural language.

Amazon Q data integration in
AWS Glue is a new capability
of Amazon Q Developer that enables you

to build data integration
pipelines using natural language.

Describe your intent
through a chat interface
and Amazon Q data integration
will generate a complete job for you.
When errors occur,

Amazon Q Developer can
help you troubleshoot them.

Amazon Q Developer provides
you with expert guidance
throughout your data integration journey.
Let's see how this works.
In the AWS Management Console
or the AWS Glue Console,
I can ask Amazon Q

for best practices for
building a Glue job.

Amazon Q will process
the prompt and provide
a relevant and accurate response.

It will provide links
to public documentation
for me to deep dive.

I can use Amazon Q for
data pipeline authoring.

Here I ask Amazon Q to
generate a Glue script

that extracts data from
my Amazon S3 bucket,
so a data transformation such as a filter,

and load the results
in the Amazon Redshift.
Amazon Q quickly generates a script for me
to review and put into my job.

I can also ask Amazon Q
for more complex pipelines.
I ask Amazon Q to write me a Glue script
that reads JSON files from one S3 bucket,
extracts CSV files from another S3 bucket,

performs a join on the
data, adds a filter,

and finally write the
results to Amazon DynamoDB.
Amazon Q again generates a script for me
to review and put into my job.
Amazon Q can build complex jobs
with a wide variety of sources, targets,
and data transformations.
To put this job into production,
I copy it over to the script editor,
change the connection parameters,
saves the job, and I'm ready to go.

Finally, Amazon Qcan help
me troubleshoot jobs.

Suppose my Glue job is
encountering memory issues.

I can ask Amazon Q for
advice on how to prevent
out of memory errors for my Glue job.
As you see here,

Amazon Q quickly generates
relevant responses with links

to public documentation
and best practices.
This concludes our demo

on how you can use
Amazon Q data integration

and AWS Glue to build
data integration pipelines
using natural language.
